campaign.story:
Huge Update:
With just a few days left we are blowing out all the stops!  Forget the $50 k Stretch Goal, we are unlocking it early anyway!  Yep!  Any backer can now add a playmat to their pledge.  Remember, you are limited to the # of copies of the game you are backing though!  If you are pledged for 4 copies of the game then YES you can add 4 playmats at $7 each (+$1 shipping to Canada, + $2 shipping Worldwide).  Yes, these are huge 20" X 20" playmats and yes they will retail for $15-$20 or possibly more!  100% 1.5 MM Neoprene with full color cloth top, these are of the same quality as our other mats that have been so popular like our Dead Man's Draw Mats (long sold out) and our as yet unreleased Viceroy Mats.  Come and get 'em while their hot, we expect these to sell out quickly once we release them!
Forget $50 K, this is UNLOCKED NOW! Increase your pledge for a mat now!

But why a playmat?  
Organized Scoring: Each player has a place on the mat to keep track of their own bark/core (up to 6 Players) Single/Double Scoring Area: Each player has a separate place on the playmat to keep their single/double point bark/core. If you use the golden Axe or have another modifier in play then you need to keep a separate pile of your "double point" pieces, this helps a TON!  
Neoprene = Less Lost Pieces: The mat will be a nice bouncy/soft neoprene with a 4 inch radius around the tree that is the "fall zone" where most of the bark/core fall. This means less hard bouncing on the table and less pieces bouncing off the table and lost. It speeds up the game and makes game play easier on the ears! 
More immersive to the theme: Some of you have been asking for a redesign on the base of the tree because it isn't "tree like" enough, but we just aren't able to do that. Instead having a "lumberjack themed" mat will add to the immersion of the game and hopefully combat the asthetics of a less tree-like base. 
This playmat will be pretty large, at 20 X 20 Inches, and we will retail it for $15-20 USD or more when we release it to the general public AFTER fulfilling the KS.
Add Ons!
 We just had a HUGE UPDATE!  You can now back for up to 6 copies of the game, add on Bling Bling Gemstone and several other Mayday Games' Games to your rewards!  Check out all the ADD ONs and more HERE.
Why back now?
The Platinum Level filled up in less than 2 days and the GOLD LEVEL is also sold out!  Only those at the Silver Level will get the Silver Level Sticker included in their shipment, designating their copy as one of the first 1,500 released.  The sticker will be nice and shiney and hand-numbered as X of 500 Silver Level Backers!  
 Note the Silver Sticker will come with your shipment but not attached to the game, you can apply it yourself to the box, rulebook, or anywhere you want.
                                      We really wanted to use this video as our Kickstarter video, it explains Tok Tok Woodman in typical hilarious British fashion. If you only watch one video on Youtube this year, it should be THIS, but if you watch two, well, check this out:
 Yes, take all the brilliance of this video and add in grub stickers, multi-colored bark for more scoring/variant opportunities, take out the British charm, and you have Click Clack Lumberjack!
So what is different?  Here is a quick summary:
                                                  Newly redesigned and improved packaging (more like Bling Bling and the reprint of Tok Tok Woodman)
Updated Artwork (check out the box and instructions below)
Additional variants and rules for even more replay-ability.
Smaller shelf space for more portability and travel fun
Lower MSRP than Bling Bling and significant savings to KS backers!
Stretch rewards including the much sought after Golden Axe and Golden Bark/Core Expansions AND cards like we offered our Bling Bling project backers
Three unique colors of bark for a great 3-player game or added variability and variations of play.
That's right, we've taken the original Tok Tok Game, added the grub stickers and extra variants of Click Clack Lumberjack (2013 version), and thrown in the 3-player and multi-level scoring of Bling Bling Gemstone, and put it all together with brand new packaging for a comprehensive game that offers the best of all three games!
 Check out the all-new revamped rules HERE.
There are so many positive videos and reviews of this system already, across all 3 games, that we hardly know where to start!  Here are just a FEW of them:
Click Clack Lumberjack Reviews:
"I’ll just come right out and say it: this one is a must-have...  I’ve played this with my kids and with hardcore strategy gamers, and it’s always a blast—and it’s hard to play just once.  ..so it’s a great party game, and it doesn’t take long" -GeekDad as originally published on Wired.com
"Perfect for all ages, “Click Clack Lumberjack” is a fun, quick party game that won’t disappoint" -Dad's Gaming Addiction and Youtube video HERE
"I was amazed with the components that come in the game. They are extremely high quality with very thick pieces and when you complete the tree it just looks awesome.  If you were playing this at a party or with a large group, the game play and components will draw people to the game just wondering what you are playing.  This game also works quite well with kids. My oldest is a little young for this game, but she gets the idea and finds it fun. I think kids over 5 will have a blast with this game and so will their parents.
Click Clack Lumberjack embodies the essence of what a filler game should be. It’s simple to learn, a blast to play and doesn’t take the whole night to play. I honestly think that Click Clack Lumberjack needs to be available for the masses in big chain stores and would easily take the place of Jenga in my collection if I owned it. Click Clack Lumberjack is a great vertical dexterity game that you can play with people of all ages and one I think most should own." -BoardGameQuest.com
"The Child Geeks LOVED Click Clack Lumberjack and asked for it again and again. And again. We played this game a lot. To a point where everyone but the youngest of Child Geeks was tired of it. But even after playing it many times in a row, it still brought smiles, cheers, boos, and high-fives. The game was a real pleasure for the Child Geeks and it showed. They were enthusiastic, engaged, and best of all, geeking out. According to one Child Geek, “THIS IS THE GREATEST GAME EVER!!!” No, it’s not, but that isn’t the point. The point is that Click Clack Lumberjack was approved by the Child Geeks many times over." -FatherGeek.com
Tok Tok Woodman Reviews
  There are TONS and TONS of videos and reviews of this game but that is all we will show you here!
"No one plays this without showing some emotions. Anger, frustration, humor but most of all laughing aloud about ones own inability to get that one easy piece. One of the best starters EVER." -Timo Schneider, Germany
"10/10"  -Matthew M Monin (Octavian on BGG), USA
"Get out the Hatchet and ratchet up some fun. Timber!! have some bark Buster. A great simple to play, fun filler after a heavy night of gaming.!" -Rick Stonebraker, Fort Wayne, IN, USA
"This was nuts too. It involved swinging an axe and weird Jenga style goals. It was so silly it was great." -Sheamus Parkes on BGG, Indianapolis, IN, USA

"A really crazy little game that was a big hit with the family. A strange game that was compared to Jenga, but really that is VERY superficial. The only real similarity is that it is a column that toppling results in an end game. Mostly, you will find yourself getting only one point per turn, but my son even got two and three points. Very fun, quick and addicting. I think this will be going on the wishlist!" -Nate Downs, Granville OH, USA
Bling Bling Gemstone Reviews
 Check out the video review from the Dice Tower above.  To summarize though, Tom Vasel says if you are going to get one version of this game, that this is the version to get as it has the most variety to game play.  We are so happy to incorporate the variety of Bling Bling with the accessibility and broad appeal of Tok Tok!
Comments from BGG:
10/10: "Quick to set up, quick to teach, quick to play, and very engaging and fun in such a short amount of time. I think this is going to become one of my game night staples so long as I'm gaming with people that like dexterity games." -Edna Lindebury, Columbus Ohio, USA
"Great silly fun for the whole family! My six year old girl jusr loves it. Quick gameplay and lots of tension. Only drawback is the kind of fiddly setup." -Andreas Josefsson, Sweden
"Hilarious" -Lief Klein Konijntje, The Netherlands
"Neat little dexterity time that catches the eye and plays in just a few minutes. I think this will be a keeper for me, because it's so unique and charming." -Zee Garcia, Homestead Florida, USA
Additional variants and three colored bark - by very popular demand/request we are including some specially designed GRUB stickers that you can attach to the bark for lots more variation on the game. You can assign each grub to be worth double points and put them on the inside or outside of the bark if you wish, you can make a rule that any player that hits a grub piece off has to skip a turn, or hit with their other hand for a turn or two,   The grub just add more options to the game and the possibilities are extensive! 
The best thing about Bling Bling Gemstone is the three colors of gems.  These allow for great 3-player cutthroat style games but also allow for variable scoring for each color, bringing a new element of strategy to the game.  Play the game as one point per bark and negative five points for the core, or get all mathy and score each bark color as 1, 2 and 3 points and count the core as negative 10.  Either way, you have a game that has more variants and more replayability.  
Lower MSRP and sigificant savings to KS backers - If you check our original 2011 Kickstarter you will see the lowest price point was $27 for delivery within the USA, and it went up from there.  Tok Tok retails for $25 but this new version will have to retail for $30 due to increased manufacturing costs and exchange rate issues.  The savings for you on Kickstarter are HUGE and significant!  We are pricing this as low as we possibly can to save you off of the retail price!
Stretch Rewards - We have some excellent stretch rewards as outlined below and we think they will offer all of you backers a reason to support this project, in addition to all of the goodies mentioned already. OK, so having said all that, lets face it, this is Tok Tok revisited. If you already have Tok Tok Woodman you may not need this game, but if you don't... well here is your big chance!
So let's face it, we have had a lot of previous KS projects and all of the games have been successful.  In fact, we've never had an unsuccessful game on Kickstarter.  You'd think by now that we would be "set" and not need to do such a project any more, right?  Well, not so much.  While Mayday has been successful, we are still very small.  In fact we are just a few employees.  We are a very small game company and all of our cash is tied up in other projects.  In fact if you look at our history we introduced just 3 new games in 2010 and 2011 before Kickstarter.  Since KS we have had nearly 20 new games, but that is ALL thanks to backers like you. 
                                                  By doing the KS program we are able to gauge interest and get the game made in much larger quantities and with cheaper prices to our customers.  This is a large part of why we can offer our last few KS projects at such a low price point.  With this much stuff in the game and such a small company, this would only be possible with the support of the KS community. 
Please note that we have priced the rewards at BARE BONES pricing, we can only offer the prices here that we are by keeping the extras to a bare minimum.  Rather than jacking the price way up and throwing in "free stuff" we have decided to keep the price as low as possible and let you decide which extras you want in your game as add-ons for the most part.  Here are some of our initial stretch goals for this campaign:
Goal met, we will produce the game and all backers will receive their rewards!  We really hope this will be met without any trouble as all of our previous 20+ Kickstarter Projects have been successful!   
Limit one axe per copy of the game you pledge for, sorry, supplies are very limited!
We reached the $15 K stretch goal in under two days and have unlocked the much-sought after Golden Axe expansion for the game. We retail these two nifty little expansions for over $8 for the pair, but we will make them available to you backers for just $1 each, and no extra shipping charge. These two expansions are GREAT fun and add a lot to the game. You can read about them HERE and HERE.
Limit one core per copy of the game you pledge for, sorry, supplies are very limited!
Note: This is just a $1 add on for all 7 cards. You are limited to just one set of bonus cards per copy of the game pledged for.
+3 Bonus Cards added to the 7 Cards from the $30 K goal. That's right, anyone pledging the extra $1 for the 7 bonus cards will ALSO get +3 more bonus cards included at no extra cost!
Read top of campaign for why this is ALREADY unlocked!
20 x 20 inch NEOPRENE playmat!
This makes 16 cards TOTAL! That's right, anyone pledging the extra $1 for the 7 Bonus cards will ALSO get all extra Bonus Cards at no extra cost!
We have had a LOT of you ask about adding extra copies of the game because you want more than just 1-2 copies. We have heard you! You can now pledge for up to 6 copies of the game. Keep in mind that only your FIRST copy will be the limited edition (hand numbered Sticker) version, all other copies will be standard versions. You can add extra funds to your pledges for each copy of the game you get though for more golden axes, golden core, golden bark and the cards too. You can also add one playmat per copy of the game you pledge for too! So how does it work?
The first and 2nd copy you could always back for at $22 per copy, plus the applicable shipping to your area ($5 shipping for the USA, $8=Canada, $12= EU, $15=Worldwide). Note the shipping is for one or two copies, so you pay no extra shipping on the 2nd copy. Any extra copies work the same way, but you pay just $20 per copy for copies 3-4 and just $19 per copy for copies 5-6. You then just add shipping at the same rate for these extra copies. Complicated? Not really, just refer to the chart below!
Just switch your PLEDGE TOTAL (dollar value) but NOT your REWARD SELECTION accordingly!

At 500 Backers every £10+ Backer will receive SIX PIN BADGES!!!

Lords of War is an award-winning, easy to learn/hard to master gateway card game for 2-8 players.
As you can see from our Let's Play video above, it takes 2 minutes to set up, 5 minutes to learn and 20-45 minutes to play.
Don't be fooled by its size - we pack a MASSIVE amount of game into each pocket-sized Lords of War "Core Game" box, including 2 complete armies, instructions and a paper Battle Mat to play on.
This means that even if you pledge for just ONE of our games then you will still have PLENTY of play to be getting on with!
Only with YOUR HELP can this game enter the world!
On top of that, with our new Magic and Monsters Expansion Packs - the latest of which this campaign will help us finance, print and ship - the intensity of Lords of War games is kicked up SEVERAL notches with Spell Casting, Flying and Monstrous Creatures and other new cards too!
All of our double-decks also contain scaling rules (Beginner, Intermediate and Advanced) meaning that whether you are a parent looking for an amazing game to play with your children, a casual player seeking a quick and fun 'filler' game or a hardened strategic gamer sporting for a challenge, Lords of War will offer you great gaming experiences and MUCH MORE!
Our busy booth at The Spiel in Essen last year.
What do we mean, MORE than a game?! Well, community is SUPER important to us. Our Facebook group is HUGELY active, we try to meet as many players as we can, our Tournament scene is growing fast AND we release tonnes of Lore completely free of charge to ensure that Lords of War feels as full and rounded as it can be.
We know that mums and dads out there read our Lore to their children at bed time. How do we know? Because they have told us, and it's something we are REALLY proud of.
Plus, this our third Kickstarter campaign, with our previous campaigns having been delivered in a few short months to lots of happy customers - we will NOT let you down!
We have worked REALLY hard to keep Lords of War compact, but you can expand the game to an epic scale if you want to.
To see how the game looks and works during a standard game then check out the Let's Play Lords of War: Elves versus Lizardmen video above or check out the VERY FIRST unboxing video which we recorded with prototype cards back in November 2012!
The key things to remember is that this isn't any kind of card game you've played before. It's NOT that mini-game from Final Fantasy VIII, it's NOT another Magic: The Gathering clone, and it's DEFINITELY not Summoner Wars.
All of those games are obviously awesome in their own right, but when you pick up Lords of War you are picking up something truly unique.
Moreover, we are regular people with full time jobs who have made this game because nothing out there quite hit the spot for us.
We wanted a game that was SUPER easy to learn but which offers a LOT more than the big LCGs, CCGs and TCGs already out there, and Lords of War does just that.
Aside from winning the UK Games Expo Award for Best Strategic Card Game, Lords of War has been widely critically acclaimed.
Below we have included a number of testimonial quotes from reviews, as well as video reviews from several online magazines and reviewers:
"This is a great game that is perfect for first timers or hard-core gamers because of the rules, the design, the art and the fun factor. 5/5"
- The Geek Syndicate
"Plenty of tactical depth and oodles of replay value... I can quite honestly say this is one of the best-looking games you'll ever play."
- Beasts of War
"I cannot recommend this game enough. There is a lot of depth to it and by adding in the Terrain and Weather cards you get the feel of a proper tabletop war game without the cost."
- Fanplastic Little Men
"For me, Lords of War has provided many hours of enjoyment and continues to do so every time it is played. Monkeys With Fire highly recommends this game!"
- Monkeys With Fire
"Lords of War is a really great game and it doesn't matter whether you're a seasoned card shark or totally new to gaming. The mechanics are simple enough to learn it quickly but the strategy is complex enough to make you want to play again and again."
- No Pun Included
"Lords of War is shaping up to be one of the best games of the year and is just starting its journey; I suggest you get on board."
- Polyhedron Collider
"It demands a lot more thought than some games ten times the size and four times the price, but one thing you won’t need to consider is whether to grab a copy or not – your answer should be a simple yes."
- The Little Metal Dog Show
"Lords of War absolutely SHINES at what it is trying to be. The design is tight and the restraint shown to keep it simple and fast playing is to be commended."
- Boardgames in Blighty
"There's really quite a lot to the strategy of Lords of War, even though it is pretty simple to learn. It doesn't take long. Definitely check it out. It's a fantastic game."
- How Lou Sees It
Here's a video review from GMS Magazine:
 Here's another one from Board To Death:
 And here's one from How Lou Sees It:
These are the things we've made to date...
The Lords of War "core" games come packaged in double-deck packs which contain two Fantasy armies illustrated by the amazing Steve Cox (Danger Mouse, Count Duckula, Roland Rat).
All of our decks are cross-compatible, which means you can play all the factions against one another, with each army requiring a different play-style.
Alternatively, can actually blend the decks together using our Ranking System to deck-build a Mercenary Army that plays exactly how you want it to, without the deck becoming overpowered.
PLUS - with the Lords of War: Magic and Monsters Expansion Packs, you can expand the Core Game to include new Unit Types in your games including new Flying Units, Monstrous Creatures and Magic Units.
You can ALSO add more decks to Lords of War to increase the player count and, with The Lords of War: Weather and Terrain Expansion Pack you can experiment with two new game modes.
Oooooh! Terrain Cards!!!
On the one hand, you can also play the Lords of War: Terrain pre-building game to create your own custom battlefields and/or you can play with the Lords of War: Weather deck to make your battles (and the game's rules) dynamically change as battles go along!
Oooooh! Weather Cards!!!

To support us, you must first SELECT THE RIGHT PLEDGE LEVEL for you by picking one of the REWARD OPTIONS from the right hand side of the page.

Once the campaign is over, and provided we fund (oh man, we hope we fund...) NICK WILL THEN MESSAGE YOU TO CONFIRM THE EXACT DETAILS OF YOUR ORDER.
Simples.
Other than that, please, PLEASE SHARE the campaign - we are a tiny company and need EVERYONE to pitch in and help spread the word!!!

Here is a breakdown of costs:
Lords of War: Orcs versus Dwarves
Lords of War: Orcs versus Dwarves is the original award-winning Lords of War pack. As with all Lords of War core decks, the game is playable out of the box and contains two complete armies - the Orcs and the Dwarves.
The Dwarves are a feisty race full of guts and rebellious tendencies. As a Faction in Lords of War, they are a great place to start, benefitting from fair amounts of defence, a balance of different card types and attacks that pack a lot of punch.
The Orcs meanwhile are a pretty foul and rowdy bunch. As a Lords of War Faction, they are all about sneaky attacks in which they deal tonnes of damage – and they actively enjoy sacrificing lots of Goblins along the way…
Lords of War: Elves versus Lizardmen
Like its predecessor Lords of War: Orcs versus Dwarves, Lords of War: Elves versus Lizardmen is a dual-deck strategic card game for two-plus players. It won the UK Games Expo Award for Best Strategic Card Game in 2013, the year of its release.
In terms of how they play, the Elves' deadly Archer and Cavalry Units form an exciting play style which is all about flexibility, light armour and cunning.
As for the Lizardmen, they are a wild and wily collection of vicious, cold-blooded beasts. Brightly coloured and extremely eye-catching, playing Lizardmen can often require some sleight of hand...
Lords of War: Templars versus Undead
The third in the Lords of War: Fantasy Battles series, Lords of War: Templars versus Undead was funded on Kickstarter and was released in May 2014. It was a nominee for the UK Games Expo Award for Best Expansion Pack last year, along with The Lords of War: Weather and Terrain Expansion Pack.
As for play styles, the Templars are a great deck for beginners. They are tough as old boots and have plenty of card-types which deal heavy damage!
The Undead meanwhile are gruesome, mean and cold to the touch, providing an awesome combination of multi-directional attacking cards, Moving Units and deadly Cavalry.
Lords of War: Orcs versus Dwarves 2 - The Magic and Monsters Expansion Pack
This game-changing expansion was brought into existence at the end of last year by our AMAZING Kickstarter supporters.
As well as expanding Army Decks to 54 cards, this expansion introduced new rules, units, unique spells and special abilities to the the Orcs and the Dwarves, including Fire and Ice-themed magic spells and LOTS more!
Lords of War: Elves versus Lizardmen 2 - The Magic and Monsters Expansion Pack
This is the reason we need your support - we are trying to fund this brand new expansion pack with this campaign. so please spread the word. Every penny matters!

The Elves spells are:
Bless
(The top left symbol) - When an Elven Mage Unit casts Bless, he casts a token onto an allied Ranged Unit. That Bless token enables that Ranged Unit to either Fire Twice in one turn or Fire Once even if engaged by an enemy Unit.
Poison
(The top right symbol) - When a Lizardmen Mage Unit casts Poison, they infect one enemy for 1 Damage. Once that enemy dies, that Poison spreads to all of their allied Units along any connecting Attack Arrows.
Air Damage
(The bottom left symbol) - When an Elven Mage Unit casts Air Damage, that Mage leaves 1 Air Damage token on an enemy card, effectively reducing their Shield Value by 1. Air Damage can be stacked and, like all Spells, can target Flying Units.
Paralyze
(The bottom right symbol) - When a Lizardmen Mage Unit casts Paralyze, they effectively immobilize an enemy card. The Spell prevents that card from Moving (even via Berserking) or Retreating.

campaign.story:
The dilemma
As a big board game fanatic, one of my favourite "couple's activities" to do with my girlfriend is playing the Lovecraftian themed Eldritch and Arkham games. We love playing these games because they have a great theme and the storyline is different with each game play depending on where the mechanic of the game takes us. The games come with standard D6 dice among other components which is nice and all, but there is also a "flaw" with that. Why? A large portion of the game is based on rolling dice to complete tests, and the result of each test is primarily binary - either a success or a fail. So we thought that a dice with a simple indication of success and failure makes more sense rather than a standard D6. This is what we called our "Dice Dilemma"  
How many success is that?
Our simplest solution to address the dice dilemma was to just purchase the official dice (ones that did not come with the original game). However, the official dice are still not 100% clear and you need to purchase 3 times the number of dice to have enough dice for the different status conditions. Additionally, the official dice were impossible to get as they are constantly out of stock, which added to the challenge.
After doing all of this, we had this brilliant idea of designing and making our own dice to address our dice dilemma once and for all. 
The solution - Introducing the Cucu Dice
A one-size-fits-all solution for Lovecraftian themed Eldritch and Arkham games or any other games that require D6 dice roll for binary resolutions.
New Dice Layout
   (Thanks everyone, especially KassFlak, for pitching in on the layout update)
First Set of Samples (Sorry about the bad lighting)
The Cucu dice can be used for any game that requires the player to roll a D6 to produce a success/failure result from each dice. It is an all-in-one solution to clearly indicate the success and failure of dice tests. However, the main design was focused on performing attribute tests in Lovecraftian themed Arkham or Eldritch games. 
How the CuCu Dice Works
Roll xD6, 1 out 6 Chance for Success (For example, Roll for 6)
Simply roll x number of the Cucu Dice, and count the number of Red Die Faces for the number of Successes.
 Roll xD6, 2 out 6 Chance for Success (For example, Roll for 5, 6)
Simply roll x number of the Cucu Dice, and count the number of Green Die Faces for the number of Successes.
 Roll xD6, 3 out 6 Chance for Success (For example, Roll for 4, 5, 6)
Simply roll x numbers of the Cucu Dice, and count the number of Blue Die Faces for the number of Successes.
 Other Rare Situations:
Add 1 to the result of a die
Simply roll x numbers of the Cucu Dice, and count the number Successes as listed above. Then look at the corresponding coloured number on the non-success dice to and add 1 to the appropriate number. 
On the corners of each face of the dice are number indicators, which allows bonus addition if certain condition permits. They are color coded to match the colored face you are rolling for. However, they are also small enough to not distract from the main design on the dice, which is what you will be paying attention to 99% the time. 
Roll xD6, 4 out 6 Chance for Success
Simply roll x numbers of the Cucu Dice, and count the number of Non-Green Die Faces for the number of Successes.
Roll xD6, 5 out 6 Chance for Success
Simply roll x numbers of the Cucu Dice, and count the number of Non-Red Die Faces for the number Success.
Example of a Roll 6D6, Success on 5 or 6 (rolling green):
Sample Dice Toss
About the CuCu Dice
The dice will be produced on a 16MM black plastic dice base. 
The side will be laser engraved to prevent the design from fading over time, maximizing dice longevity. 
The dice face will have flat edges rather than traditional round edges to maximize design area (we want and you know you also want the largest possible picture on each dice face). 
Rewards
Cucu Dice (1 set) $10 CAD (≈$8 USD) + Shipping: For ~$8 USD*, you will receive one full set of 10 beautifully crafted Standard Cucu Dice + 1x any unlocked stretch goals. 
Cucu Dice (2 sets) $19 CAD (≈$15 USD) + Shipping: For ~$15 USD*, you will receive two full set of 10 beautifully crafted Standard Cucu Dice (20) + 2x any unlocked stretch goals.
Cucu Dice (3 sets) $28 CAD (≈22 USD) + Shipping: For ~$22 USD*, you will receive three full set of 10 beautifully crafted Standard Cucu Dice (30) + 3x any unlocked stretch goals.
Cucu Dice (4 sets) $36 CAD (≈$28.5 USD) + Shipping: For ~$28.5 USD*, you will receive four full set of 10 beautifully crafted Standard Cucu Dice (40) + 4x any unlocked stretch goals.
Cucu Dice (5 sets) $44 CAD (≈$34.5 USD) + Shipping: For ~$34.5 USD*, you will receive five full set of 10 beautifully crafted Standard Cucu Dice (50) + 5x any unlocked stretch goals.
* Conversion Rate is as of March 30th, 2015. Since manufacturing costs are quoted in USD, should the Canadian dollar become more favorable at the time of production, I will add additional dice to each pledge according to the changes.
Stretch Goal
(✔ UNLOCKED) @$4400 CAD +1 additional Cucu die to each set of orders  (now 11 beautifully crafted Cucu Dice per set)
(✔ UNLOCKED) @$7700 CAD +1 additional Cucu die to each set of orders  (now 12 beautifully crafted Cucu Dice per set)
Upgrades and Add-ons:
18MM (40% larger) dice upgrade - $3 CAD per set: simply add $3 CAD (≈$2.50 USD) per set to upgrade from your 16MM Cucu dice set to 18MM Cucu dice set. You may only upgrade up to the maximum number of sets you pledged for. If you have pledge for multiple sets, you can have a mixed number of 16MM and 18MM sets. However, to keep everything organized, I cannot offer partial set upgrades, and maximum sets per pledge is 5 as noted by the pledge levels. 
Cucu Baggies - $5 CAD / $4 CAD per bag: simply add $5 CAD (≈ $4.10 USD) for 1 bag, or $4 CAD Each (≈ $3.25USD) for 2 or more bags, up to a maximum of 5 bags.
NOTE: Baggy size will be increased from 7in x 5in. Final size is yet set, but will be between 8in x 6in and 9in x 7in. 
1 Cucu baggy: Add $5 CAD to your pledge amount (≈ $4.10 USD) 
2 Cucu baggies: Add $8 CAD ($4 x 2) to your pledge amount (≈ $6.50 USD)

All the Cucu Goodness!

Current Status
After speaking with many players of the game and going through several design phases, we have a near finalized design for the dice. In addition, we are willing to make changes to ensure that your opinions and design polls are heard.
Currently, we have contacted a number of credible manufacturers to establish a sound basis for production of the dice. In order to bring this project to live, I will need to make a minimum order of 1,000 units. Together, we can achieve that.

campaign.story:
Sorry we missed you! We had a great campaign, but you can still get in on all the Vault Wars auction action. Click here for more info on where to find Vault Wars now that the project is closed!
--
When heroes are slain, their treasure-filled storage vaults are abandoned and put up for auction. As an aspiring hero, you must outbid your opponents to win these auctions and acquire the gear you need. Will you triumph by collecting a chest of gems and artifacts, or go home with a trunk full of junk? Outbid, out-bluff, and master the auctions to be victorious in Vault Wars.
Welcome
Hello, and welcome! We're Floodgate Games, the publisher of titles such as Legacy: Gears of Time and Epic Resort and we're so glad you're checking out our newest game!
Without skipping a beat from his success with Dead of Winter, we're incredibly excited to work with such a talented game designer as Jon Gilmour to publish his next game. It's been over two years in the making, and we're excited to have you join us in making this game a reality.
Break out your gavel, dust off your lock-box and get ready for action-packed auctions in Vault Wars!
Vault Wars is a tabletop auction game of bidding and bluffing for 3-5 players that plays in less than an hour. (There's a 2-player variant, too!) Check out the rule book, or follow the overview below:
Setup
Players are each given starting Gold, and two (secret) Aspiring Hero cards that give bonuses for finding specific kinds of items.
Vault cards are drafted before gameplay begins.
Gameplay
Each round, players secretly select one Vault, revealing them simultaneously. Each Vault provides a unique experience, introducing new ways for the players to bid.
Taking turns as the Auction Master, players lead a cut-throat bidding war to selling off their Vault's items to the other players.
Bidding
Players bid until 1 player is the winner -- paying the Auction Master and gaining the Vault's Items.
Collect gems for massive Victory Points, Weapons to gain a pile of Gold, or rare Artifacts to gain powerful abilities. In addition to valuable Items, there's lots of junk to fool your opponents into bidding on.
Selling Items
After all selected Vaults have been auctioned off, players may sell their items to gain Gold, or save them for Victory Points -- paying storage fees to keep them around. Players who are short on Gold can visit the Loan Shark, gaining Gold and taking a Corruption Token (worth negative Victory Points).
End of Game
The player with the most victory points from Items and one Aspiring Hero after all the auctions will be the winner!  
Side Note: Vault Wars is a standalone game thematically set in the same fantasy world as our previous game Epic Resort; you don't need to have any experience with Epic Resort to enjoy Vault Wars.
 We'll be releasing reviews over the first week or so of the campaign to help give each reviewer some time in the spotlight. Below you'll find some of our favorite reviewers -- if you enjoy what they do please be sure to let them know!
"This game is a really, really clever design... this is something that you're going to want to play with a lot of people, just because it's so cool and fun" 
Gameplay Runthrough
 Final Thoughts
More Rahdo Videos: 2 Player Variant Extended Gameplay
 "There are so many things I like about this game... for a game that has some really basic mechanisms it's got a lot going for it. It's a heckuvalotta fun"
More Grey Elephant Gaming Videos: "Quick Preview"
Cardboard Republic - Previewing: Vault Wars - "For those who enjoy auction mechanics, Vault Wars is one safe bet. Vault Wars challenges players to interact, with everyone possessing different amounts of hidden information, and yet it isn't a deduction game. It also encourages players to bluff and deceive their competition, and yet it isn't a game about lying. Instead, Vault Wars weaves seemingly disparate mechanics together in a way that’s both psychologically and mechanically engaging."
Kickstarter Tabletop Alert -  "I’m impressed with the amount of game packed into a pretty simple set of components. It’s one I’d recommend especially for people who like games with a good social element and 'playing the player,' plus if you’re a fan of Storage Wars you may get a kick out of the reference."
Review - "At the core of Vault Wars is a very well designed game, full of depth, tactics, and strategy."
Glory Box - "Vault Wars is an absolute bloody pleasure. An hour of roaring at friends, accusing them of deception, while all the time you’ve been lying through your teeth as you scrabble for every coin and every point available to you. "
Kickstarter Project Review - "I really, really like Vault Wars. It's a lot of fun"
Board Game Quest
Vault Wars Preview - "If you are a fan of auction games, then you need to check out Vault Wars. It puts a new spin onto a genre of game that I usually enjoy. I thought the that inclusion of hidden information was a great twist that can sometimes pay dividends… or come back to bite you in the butt.
Vault Wars ended up being a fun game with a lot of creative twists on the auction genre. I think that the play time hits the sweet spot"
I Slay The Dragon
EVERYTHING MUST GO! - "Vault Wars also has a pleasantly high replay value for a design of its style, type, length, and depth .... If you like or enjoy bidding games, Vault Wars is right in your wheelhouse.  What’s more though, it offers a few sophisticated, but not overly complex, aspects that will appeal more broadly.  It might not be filler material, but it’s neither time consuming nor mentally investing.  It provides just enough challenge and has a fun thematic application that it should find plenty of space on many a different table."
Board Games with Flartner
Preview - "Vault Wars is a pretty simple game, but definitely does a lot of things right. It has a basic structure, and then adds to that structure in interesting ways by having the vaults change how much information players have and how the auctions work"
3D rendering of the box and components
Each copy of Vault Wars will be packed with high quality components: thick punchboards for tokens, 280 GSM cards (STRETCH REWARD UPGRADE: 300 GSM Linen Finish) and a strong, portable box. Each card features beautiful original illustrations by Kelly McClellan and Jacqui Davis. In addition to a useful insert and full color rule book, you'll also get:

It's an exciting time for us as gamers with so many unique and interesting games, and I'm honored to have you consider Vault Wars as one of those options. Here are just a few reasons why we feel this project is worth your support.
Fast Moving and Fun - The rhythm of Vault Wars is quick to learn, and the thematic elements tie closely to their game impact; helping you stay focused on having fun and keeping an eye on your tricky opponents.
Unique Auction Mechanics - Variable bidding rules, partial information on Vault contents and pay-the-player are all combined into a streamlined package that keeps your whole group engaged at every turn.
You're helping Independent Game Design and Publishing - Everything you see in this project is the product of a massive effort by several passionate, independent creators. Vault Wars works great as a pure auction game, but sometimes you need a little help finding the right gear... naturally you'll hire some workers!

The longer a worker goes un-hired, the cheaper they get... but don't wait too long or your opponents will snap them up first!
If you help spread the word about the Vault Wars Kickstarter project and we can reach our stretch goals -- including the Worker Expansion in every copy of the game!! (Edit: WE DID IT, thank you!)

Risks and challenges
Easily the biggest challenges with publishing a tabletop game are manufacturing and shipping logistics. I've had smooth campaigns, and rough ones and learned a ton along the way!

This time around I'm as prepared as ever to navigate around production problems, shipping delays, national holidays to do my best to deliver a great game in a timely manner. As of the project launch, almost all of the illustration and graphic design work is complete. I'm planning to start the pre-press process before the project even closes to help give us a head start on getting Vault Wars on your table even faster!

campaign.story:
A standalone sequel - original oddball Aeronauts not required - or expands oddball Aeronauts with 2 new factions, multiplayer dogfights and still NO SURFACE REQUIRED, what more could you want?
"Snowtide!" you cry? Okay! Well a bit about that later, but first . . .
oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble
The Factions
New oddball officers, bots and crew with different deck compositions and playing styles. These guys are also armed brand with new tricks with which to dazzle your foes. These are entirely new factions all round.
Will you side with the wild and wily, gun totin' Free Kingdoms or the outlawed, gadget obsessed Mechinauts?
Rallied together to stay free of the Pendragon's rule and to wipe out all automatons to the last golem!
They've arisen and they've brought their army of outlawed automatons with them.
If you want to know how these new factions differ from the factions in original oddball Aeronauts and their new tricks, well . . .
Multiplayer Rules
What happens when three or four Factions find themselves facing off over the same patch of sky? Well now you can find out!
'oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble' comes with rules for three or four players so if you have a second deck such as the Pilot Set you're all set for oddball aeronautical dogfights the likes of which even ancient clouds have never seen! And that is saying something!
You can try out the multiplayer rules and get a sneaky beaky peaky at the two new factions by downloading our Double the Trouble print and play demo.
The Feedback
"This game already has so much going for it . . . and in my opinion they've only made it better! This sequel keeps pushing the cleverness, while giving new options for fun. If you liked the first game, this is a no-brainer. If you're not sure, this is a great diving-in point, since the sequel is also a standalone game. Well done Maverick Muse!" Theology of Games preview
"oddball Aeronauts 2 is a worthy second edition to the world of oddball Aeronauts. You get two unique new factions which are very well-balanced with the original games decks, but also add new experiences." Boardgamequest preview
Plus . . .
Rahdo's . . . Talk Through!
THE DECK
This amazing (of course we would say that) oddball sequel gives you the core faction cards for both the Mechinauts and the Free Kingdoms, some strange new Events and a small huddle of new Mercenaries just waiting to make trouble - all the cards you need for two players to play right out of the pocket sized box.
26x Core Free Kingdoms Faction Cards
26x Core Mechinauts Faction Cards
4x Mercenary Cards
6x Event Cards
1x Tricks Glossary & Multiplayer Rules Booklet*
*While this Faction Set doesn't include the core rules, you don't need the original Pilot Set to play these two new factions, just download the original full 2 player game rules for free here.
Snowtide is here! What is it? Well, Snowtide is made up of 2 micro-expansions of 5 cards each. The first - 5 Snowtide Event Cards - will be sent to every backer at Pilot level and above as a free bonus!
The second - 5 Snowtide Mercenary Cards - is an add-on. Add £3.21 to your pledge and you'll receive these 5 Snowtide Mercenaries.
You can find all the details in Update #14 - do check it out before asking questions!
(Note: The Snowtide cards will be made available in the future direct from Maverick Muse as one micro-expansion of 10 cards. This will retail at a price of £10 and won't be available until Dec. 2015 at the earliest.)
oddball Aeronauts is a light strategy, play in the hand (no surface required) card game of dirigible duels set in a steampunk-esque fantasy world. It was originally funded here on Kickstarter in February (check out the page here).
2 Player (You'll need two sets for 3 or 4 player games)
15-20 minutes
Ages 9yrs and beyond!
In brief: Pick a Skill. Decide how many cards to play. Compare with your opponent to determine the result. Use special abilities and plan moves in advance to swing things your way where you can. You discard the cards you played and if you lose, could discard more . . . or your opponent could get cards back. You win the game when your opponent has discarded all their cards.
Rahdo (aka Richard Ham) gives a very good run through of the game in this gameplay run through video. Note that this was for the prototype and some things were improved for the finished Pilot Set, including the box quality and a few tricks and notations on the cards.
Where to get the Original oddball Aeronauts
If perchance you did want to get your mitts on the full printed rules or if you desired to take the Pirate and Pendragon airships to the skies you can get your paws on a copy of the Pilot Set via Amazon US or Amazon UK or our website or your UK FLGS (US distribution pending).
Reviews
(For the final production version of the Pilot Set:)
"Really fun, really interesting, really light, really quick to play. Easy to learn. The artwork on it is really cool. It’s a lot of fun. It just works. It’s really, really cool." Anthony 'Cardboard Jungle Podcast' Ep. 45
“Parent Geek approved! Child Geek approved! Oddball Aeronauts is a fun adventure and an easy play that can be enjoyed just about anywhere and anytime with the exception of swimming and skydiving. That’s pretty cool and makes the game unique right from the start.” - Cyrus Kirby 'Father Geek' review
"oddball Aeronauts has a lot going for it. It’s full of quick, tight gameplay, interesting bluffing, and has lots of replay value." Dan Thurot 'Space-Biff' review
For more reviews on oddball Aeronauts fly your dirigible over to our website.
The art for the cards is finished so as soon as we get all the new Crew and Captain names onto the cards they'll be ready to go. With the Tricks Guide written and the art for the box complete we'll be ready to go to the printers. We just need the funds to make oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble happen.
Name the crew. We'd love your input! Across the net we are once again asking you to name our card characters. The chosen names will grace the final cards themselves, just like in the Pilot Set.
Previously on #namethat: thanks to a combo of suggestions this Free Kingdoms fellow was named Atticus Oakley Esquirrel
Name the Captains. For a chance to name the two captains keep an eye on our updates. You'll need to be a backer to throw in your name idea into the hat.
Next on #namethat: Name a name for the nameless captains so they can have a name!
Extra Copies
oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble will have an MSRP of £13 in the UK. As a backer you can get a copy for £12.
If you would like to order additional copies of 'oddball Aeronauts: Double the Trouble' simply add £10 to your pledge total for each additional copy. Worldwide shipping is included in this amount.
Shipping
We have included worldwide shipping. We'll need your current address and should you move we'll need you to let us know your new address as soon as you know it and before we ship. We'll let you know when we're about to start the shipping run just before we begin.
Once we receive oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble, it could take between 2 to 12 weeks for you to receive your copy of the game and you could receive your copy anytime during this period. But if you would like yours to be expedited - with you in a matter of days - or tracked, then we can accommodate.
Please read our Shipping Options article for all the details on shipping.
Custom Cards - Some reward levels above Pilot give you the opportunity to own your own custom cards. These cards are in addition to the 'Double the Trouble' Set. You'll get to choose art and give your new Captain or Crew a custom name*.
* Keep names to - 
Under the given letter count 
In the English language
Keep them clean
No symbols or trademarks
Having said all that, we want you to have fun with it, this is an oddball world where quirky names are the common names. There are a few other limitations too, so read the accompanying articles on our website for full details.
Ace Pilot
This pledge level gives you 2x custom Captain cards. This works as follows:
1. Choose your two Captains from the Rogue Captains Gallery which you can find in our Ace Pilot article. The gallery has four captain art variants for each faction to choose from, including the captains from the core Set.
2. Name your two Captains*. Your chosen names will appear on your cards.
Sorry about the Googly Eyes
3. Submit your choices via the Kickstarter survey. We'll send this out shortly after the end of the project. You have the duration of the project to decide on the art and names you'd like.
Please double check all spelling! We'll be copy/pasting your names from your survey into the cards so please make sure that the name is exactly as you want it.
Read our Ace Pilot article for further details.
Chosen Captain
This pledge level gives you even more choice for your custom Captain card than the Ace Pilot. This works as follows:
1. Choose one officer or one individual crew character from one of the factions. You can browse the available card art in this PDF of card art samples. Your chosen character will be promoted to a Captain card for that same faction.
2. Name your Captain*. Your chosen name will appear on your Chosen Captain card.
Every Captain needs a nickname, even if it doesn't mean anything
3. Submit your choices via the Kickstarter survey.
Read our Chosen Captain article for further details.
Motley Crew
This pledge level gives you 3 copies of a custom Crew card. This works as follows:
1. Choose three officers or individual crew characters in total from any faction. You can browse the available card art here. These three characters will come together to form your Motley Crew card.
2. Name your Crew*. Your chosen name will appear on your Motley Crew card.
This reward might just make you feel good
3. Submit your choices via the Kickstarter survey.
The final crew card your chosen art will inhabit is predecided for each faction. You can choose for your Motley Crew to belong to any one of the four factions.
Read our Motley Crew article for further details.
Paint Your Own Captain
This pledge level gives you maximum customisation of a custom Captain card. This works as follows:
1. Choose a line art character from the oddball line art gallery (including Ace Pilot Rogue Captains), download and colour it (or even change it as you will - add a monocle, or hat, or pet bot, or . . .). Alternatively, create your own oddball character (check out our Paint Your Own Captain article for details and limitations, accepted file types and so on). Send us your finished art and we'll use it to create a one of a kind custom Captain card.
2. Name your Captain*. Your chosen name will appear on your Paint Your Own Captain card.
Fly your own colours. (Character colours by Erin, age 12. Thanks Erin!)
3. Submit your name choices via the Kickstarter survey and send your art to our 'designers' email before 31st December 2014.
Read our Paint Your Own Captain article for further details.
Hero & Legend
At these pledge levels you'll get original art custom cards. You'll get to work with our resident artist, Lloyd Ash, to create a one off Captain or airship. Read our Original Art Cards article for details.
The Token Journal
Any backer from Pilot Reward or above may opt in to this sticktacular interactive reward. So what is it?
As many of you helped us massively with our last Kickstarter by spreading the word about oddball Aeronauts we thought we’d put something fun together for those of you willing to help us again. It's a token of our gratitude for your oddballian efforts in going that extra virtual aerial mile! We’ve come up with 6 things and for each one you complete, you’ll get a sticker added to your Token Journal. Collect all 6 and get a nice, shiny, gold, special 7th sticker.
And, if you get all 6 stickers and we reach double our funding goal (£22,222), you’ll get a special game card as an extra bonus. Your Token Journal will be sent out to you with your copy of the game.
Let the Stickertastic Token frenzy commence!
 1. Choose a Token to aim for. There are six Tokens in total, each with totally achievable Things To Do to earn it:
PuzzleBot: Take part in our online PuzzleQuestThingamajig
HailsBot: Social Media . . . stuff
JourneyBot: Post a Photo of playing oddball Aeronauts showing off its 'Play Anywhere' feature, such as on holiday, on a bus etc.,
ReviewBot: The clue is in the name!
CreatorBot: Put your stamp on the oddball Realms
LeagueBot: Play in the online League of Extra-oddball Aeronauts
2. Do the 'Thing' required to get you the Token
3. Tell us about your activity (what and where) via email
4. Pick another Token Thing to Do as desired and do that too! Anyone completing all six will get an extra FlagsBot Token for the Journal's reverse side
The Journal with your earned Tokens (stickers ready to be stuck on the journal by you) will accompany your physical rewards.
Important! See our website's Token Journal article for full details.
The 'Field Guide for Troublemakers' PDF
All backers at the Auxiliary Pilot pledge level and above will get a copy of the Field Guide for Troublemakers PDF.
Essential information in order to stay out of, or get into, trouble
This digital pocket book gives a curious aeronaut inside info on troublesome bots, vexing events and a selection of gear as carried by Mechinauts and Free Kingdoms crew and officers.
Add-on: Custom Named Figurehead Card
For any backer that pledges at the ACE PILOT level or above you can add £3 to your pledge to get a custom named Figurehead card, which carries the name of the ship.
For each £3 you add to your pledge you will get 1x Figurehead card with your chosen ship's name on it. Simply choose a faction and tell us your custom name in the backer survey.
You can choose a Figurehead from any of the four factions: Free Kingdoms, Mechinauts, Pendragon or Pirates.
Your chosen name will appear as the 'nickname' and preceding the ship class in the full name position on the card. For example: 'Quixote' / 'Quixote' Monolith where Monolith is the ship's class.
When we have funded, the cards in the expansion set will be linen finish, as promised in our first Kickstarter.
And on hitting the magical £16,161 we will throw in two alternative Captains as extra cards for Pilot backers and above: 1x Mechinauts Captain and 1x Free Kingdoms Captain. These will be the Rumblester and Lord of Ranges captains as available at the Ace Pilot reward level so keep this in mind when making your choices if you are pledging for Ace Pilot captains.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Can we fulfill on time again?

Excluding the odd package lost in the post (which we replaced and would do again) we fulfilled our last Kickstarter on time and even earlier for some backers, thanks to our organised and hard working fulfilment bots and those crazy and unpredictable shipping companies.

To prevent this from happening again . . . no wait . . . that was a good thing, right? 

Okay, forget that! This time round we are giving you the option to upgrade your shipping if you wish. See 'Shipping' in the main description above for the link to full details of the service and additional cost.

If You Change Your Address
We'll be asking for your address details in the survey. If you change your address at a later date then let us know as soon your new address is known to you. It's important we get this information before we begin to ship (we will give you a heads up before we begin shipping). If we have to ship your goods twice due to a change of address we will have to charge you a second shipping cost before we send your rewards again.

Custom Cards
Please note that custom cards may differ slightly in final colours when compared to the cards in the faction decks. This is an unavoidable part of the printing process. The difference is often barely noticeable but it's a reality of printing so please bear that in mind regarding any custom or alternative art cards offered through this Kickstarter, whether as a reward or as a stretch goal.

updates.update_content:
Well, lookee here . . . what’ve we got?
Something I think you might possibly, maybe, be interested in turned up at oddball central today.
A lorry -

Wotcha aeronautians
With production of 'oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble’ in full swing, we’ve turned our attention to the other items you’ll be busting a gut to receive.
First up are those cards of a Snowtide nature. Well, you’ll be pleased to know that the proof copies are riding an icy wind to oddball central as I type this and will be with us early next week. So, that’s those in the Snowtide Father’s bag (as the saying goes).

News Flash!
Not a Snooze Flash!
oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble moves to the production line!
(And I’m going to put an exclamation point at the end of every one of these lines!)

Production
We trust you all had a terribly spiffing and awesomely excellent Snowti . . . Christmas and wish every single one of you happiness in abundance and a hugely prosperous 2015.
We had a holiday period full of mischief, shenanigans, oddballishnesses, a little mayhem and much magiqh. Some of the mischief must have rubbed off magiqhly onto the banking industry as there was a teensy, weensy hiccup getting the Kickstarter funds into our account. Still, these bankers are no match for us maverick muses and their nefarious plan caused no delay as our manufacturer was closed over the holiday period anyway and only returned to fire up the printing presses again yesterday. Which is when we made our first payment to instigate the production of oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble. So we had the last laugh - Ha! Boo sucks to you bankers!

Apparently there’s some earth-bound holiday coming up next week. Something called “Christmas’? Sounds quite a bit like Snowtide to me. Another case of Earth nicking our oddballian traditions. Sheeesh.
Anyways, cos you’re all going to be embroiled up to your eyebrows in preparing for Snowti . . . I mean Christmas, we’ll be keeping this short and sweet.
First up - in case you didn’t know, it takes Kickstarter a couple of weeks to collect all pledges and then transfer funds. So this’ll be hitting our account early next week and we’ll then be able to make the first payment on production and the manufacture of oddball Aeronaut 2 : Double the Trouble will be underway . . .

Wot Ho Chapesses and Chaps
Here we are a week on and the wheels are in motion, the cogs are spinning as smooth as melted butter on toast and we’re into pre-production mode. But what does that mean?
Well, first off it meant that we had to complete the names on every card so that none of those oddball characters would head into the oddball skies without an appropriate oddball moniker - I mean, how embarrassing would that be?

Dear Mavericks, Muses, oddballs, or just friends [delete as appropriate]
So our 2nd little Kickstarter has come to a close and we’re mightily, excitedly, pleased to announce that 'oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble' will be going to print and you can all look forward to receiving your copy next year. Yeeeeeeeeeeee-HAA! And it’s all thanks to you. All 655 of you oddballian entrepreneurs!
So a huge, gigantic, humungous maverick thank you to every one of you for backing our little dream.

HI everyone
This is my first board game.  I would really like to market my first board game.  But more like the Role playing game which people can play  and figure out how they will achieve their goals with their characters. 
The following things I would like to do to really get this project started.
Board game Description:
An Island game played by each player.  Everybody will have a mission to complete depending on the character they play. 
Story goes like this:
A bunch of survivors airplane crash landed on the island.  They suddenly found themselves stranded but they were not alone.  During their survival journey they realized they have to survive against two rival parties.  As you play a character in this game, each of the character has an objective.  You will face harsh events where your survival skills will be tested.  Pick up items to aid you in this journey as you will need to  complete your mission before the other party does.
Survivor - must try to find ways to escape the island.  Survivors goal is to work together to ensure their survival and escape the Pirates and indigenous.  Pirates will rob the survivors treasure while indigenous will use them as sacrifice. 
Pirates - They are treasure hunters.  Pirates believe there is treasure on the island.  Their goal is to find number of treasure pieces which belongs to the indigenous.  Pirates are very powerful and they have battleships along the coast.  However their weakness is that they are unable to use traps in which survivors and indigenous uses.  
Indigenous - The God's have been displeased that the totem has been lost.  The Totem is made of golden material which is extremely valuable for pirates.  However the items were lost and to satisfy their God's, they must make sacrifice until the curse is lifted.  They can hunt either the survivors or pirates to achieve their goal.
Your character will be unknown to each other in the beginning until you start using items.  The each character will have their own advantage and disadvantages.  The island has many tunnels and event trigger which will test the survival of each parties. 
In this game there will be many items to collect.  However only one group out of the three can achieve victory.  They can only achieve victory by reaching their goal or collecting enough treasure points, or items which will aid in their escape. 
What I need to complete this game:
An Artist  - Budget $1000
Model designer (for tokens) - $2000
Card Designer- $ 2000
Board - $3000 
Printing cost would be approximately $
My Goal is to print 100 of these for the market and testing. 
And venue to test the board game such as Meet up groups.
I really like you to be part of my exciting adventure as I believe this board game will help challenge each and every one of you.  I plan to build more board games in the future however this would be my first one and I believe with adequate funding.  I will be able to spend more time and resource designing this.  I wish you all the best :).  Thank you for your support. As we go along I will provide more incentives and for those who provide bigger donations. 
Charles Lee

Meanwhile, if you're just joining us, the Lords of War series of card games come from from award-winning, independent, UK-based games publisher Black Box Games.
Although we have already released three Lords of War games and an expansion pack in the Lords of War series, chances are you won't have heard of us.
That's because we are a fast-growing company - we have been around for less than two years and have sold over 10,000 games in that time - but the world is a very big place!
This is one of our recent sales flyers. Learn more about us on www.lords-of-war.com!
Very excitingly, we have recently done deals with Heidelberger Spielverlag in Germany and ACD Distribution in the United States, with the German Language version of Lords of War having been released on Thursday last week.
The German Edition had SOLD OUT by the Saturday of the world's largest game show - The Spiel - which happened last weekend. We were there and had a great time!!
Our busy booth at The Spiel. See a full gallery of photos on https://www.facebook.com/BBG.lordsofwar
We also attended WynterCon in Eastbourne in the UK from Friday 31st October-Sunday 2nd November. If you came along and met us, THANK YOU - and if you were one of the people who pushed us over the 100% Funded line, THANK YOU SO SO SO MUCH!!!
Our team of AMAZING volunteers.
Up until now, every Lords of War game has been designed to work on its own, completely independently of the others, although you have always been able to play any of the armies against one another or mix the decks up to build balanced Mercenary armies!
With Lords of War: Magic and Monsters, we're adding a HUGE amount of new stuff to Lords of War in the form of our first full Deck Expansions!
If you know the game, you're going to love what we have planned. If you've never heard of us, now is the time to jump on board!
What are we offering?
Our first objective was to fund the first Lords of War: Magic and Monsters game THIS HAS BEEN ACHIEVED!!! We will now be able to get it to backers and retailers in time for Christmas.
If we manage to significantly exceed our funding goal, we know EXACTLY what we would do next...
Pledge £50 or more and if we reach £16,000 you'll get Lords of War: Elves versus Lizardmen 2 FOR FREE in April 2015!!!
And what that means in practice is:
New Rules!
New Victory Conditions!
New Special Card Functions!
Dozens of New Cards!
Spell Tokens!
New Lords of War Stories!
What do you mean "Lords of War Stories?"
Lords of War is made all the more unique by its ever-expanding Story and World.
You can read all about the Lore of Lords of War on our website, including over 30 stories and over 100 Unit Histories!
Alternatively, listen to the Volume I of The Lords of War: Orcs versus Dwarves Audio Book for free on YouTube!
PLUS, you can now listen to Volume I of the Lords of War: Elves versus Lizardmen Audiobook too!! 
So, how much does everything cost?
Well, for the brand new Orcs versus Dwarves: Magic and Monsters...
For any one of the original Lords of War packs:
***NEW EXTRAS JUST ADDED!!!!***
How about a WHOLE NEW Lords of War game-play variant?!
It's an AMAZING deal!!!
And if you don't want them all, buy in sets of Faction Command Card groups!!
How about all the Orc Commanders as Shinies?!?
 Or perhaps the Dwarves?!?!
Perhaps the Elves?!?
 How about the Lizardmen?!?
 What about the Templars?!?
 We can't forget about - the Undead?!?
So, that's each for £5 or ALL 6 for £20!!!!
Then also, for the Lords of War: Weather and Terrain Expansion Pack...
Plus there's the Luxury Battle Mats!
Foam-backed and beautiful...
The Orc! ***EXCLUSIVE!!!***
The Dwarf! ***EXCLUSIVE!!!***
The Sepia Terrain! ***NEW!!!!***
The Templar! ***NEW!!!***
And, of course...
The Undead!
And, finally, the Lords of War Card Tin!
Wait! I'm new to the game! Explain the core Lords of War mechanic in 10 seconds!
See this diagram?
The full rules are also available through the Lords of War pages on Board Game Geek.
See how every card has a shield containing a Defence Value?
See how each card has a series of numbers in their Attack Arrows on the edges or corners?
Players play one card at a time from their hand, using their cards' Attack Arrows to exceed the Defence Value on their opponent's cards.
In the above example, the Orc Butcher is DEAD (4 from the Chariot + 1 from the Spearman = 5 against the Orc Butcher's 4 Defence).
That's the mechanic in 10 seconds.
There's a lot more to the game, including special rules for Berserker, Spear, Ranged, Cavalry, Magic, Monstrous and Flying Units, but that's the absolute basics. 
Learn more about what these symbols mean on our website, www.lords-of.war.com!
Try checking out these Rules Videos for a full explanation!
Is Lords of War any good?
So far, Lords of War has won the award for Best Strategic Card Games at the UK Games Expo - the UK's largest gaming convention - as well as being reviewed very positively by several websites and magazines.
Click on the following names to read some reviews from these reputable websites - The Geek Syndicate, Beasts of War, Polyhedron Collider, The Little Metal Dog Show and Boardgames in Blighty.
Here is a review video from Board To Death:
Here's another from GMS Magazine:
Here's a brilliant Lords of War bit from Board With Life:
And here are some testimonial quotes:
"This is a great game that is perfect for first timers or hard-core gamers because of the rules, the design, the art and the fun factor. 5/5"
- The Geek Syndicate
"Plenty of tactical depth and oodles of replay value... I can quite honestly say this is one of the best-looking games you'll ever play."
- Beasts of War
"Lords of War, is a really great game and it doesn't matter whether you're a seasoned card shark or totally new to gaming. The mechanics are simple enough to learn it quickly but the strategy is complex enough to make you want to play again and again."
- No Pun Included
"Lords of War is shaping up to be one of the best games of the year and is just starting its journey; I suggest you get on board."
- Polyhedron Collider
"It demands a lot more thought than some games ten times the size and four times the price, but one thing you won’t need to consider is whether to grab a copy or not – your answer should be a simple yes."
- The Little Metal Dog Show
"Lords of War absolutely SHINES at what it is trying to be. The design is tight and the restraint shown to keep it simple and fast playing is to be commended."
- Boardgames in Blighty
"Lords of War has consistently improved with each new army and now with this set they have issued a loud challenge to all would be contenders."
- Who Dares Rolls
What new Unit Types will be introduced in this edition?
Ghalt, the continent over which the Orcs and Dwarves are warring...
Alongside more of the Unit Types and Ranks you know and love, we are introducing some new mechanics to Lords of War which are well and truly game-changing!
Lords of War: Magic and Monsters ALSO adds Moving Units into the armies which did not have them before, starting with - of course - the Orcs and Dwarves!
Magic Units
Magic Units are a major addition to Lords of War - not least because they introduce Tokens to the game!
Each Lords of War Faction contains multiple Magic Units in its Magic and Monsters Expansion, with each Faction having unique spells that only they can cast.
For the Dwarves for example, harnessing the Icy Winds of the North, their Magic Units can either deal +1 Ice Damage to their foes (Damage which lingers, even if the Magic Unit Retreats or is Eliminated) or they can cast +1 Shield onto allied Units!
The Orc Magic Units meanwhile can cast +1 Fire Damage or they ALSO have the power to turn ANY Orc Unit into a Berserker, enabling them to rampage across the battlefield and achieve multi-elimination combos!
Magic Units with Ranged capability have another MAJOR advantage: they can Fire even if Engaged!
*Note: Magic Units can deal Ranged damage *OR* cast a spell in their turn, not both!
Here's a Tutorial Video:
Monstrous Units
Monstrous Units bring a whole new level of strategic thinking to Lords of War. Not only can they all Move but, as you can see, they also have a Monstrous Defence Value.
The trick with the Monstrous Defence is that no Attack Arrow which deals EQUAL OR LESS THAN a Monstrous Unit's Monstrous Defence can damage that Monstrous Unit.
Weaker Units might be able to Engage them but your heavy damage Units will be needed to actually Eliminate them.
You'll now need to really think twice before you play out your high damage Units!
Here's a Tutorial Video!
Flying Units
Flying Units are crafty creatures primarily used to interrupt your opponent's strategies.
What makes them unique is that, despite having low Shield Values, they can ONLY be damaged or Engaged by Ranged Units or other Flying Units.
They may seem small but they are MAJOR pests!
Here's a Tutorial Video!
Orc Mage Command Card Xnurl Firebelly, now in colour. He's disgustingly beautiful!!!
What else is new?
Ragar Icebone - one of the new Dwarf Command Cards.
In addition to the above, each Faction will also be given more Special Units, more Elite Units, more Command Cards *AND* players will now hold 7 rather than 6 cards in their hand.
The Victory Conditions for Lords of War matches also change with the inclusion of Lords of War: Magic and Monsters:
- With your deck expanded to 54 cards, players now need to take 30 cards to win a match!
- With 8 Command Cards now in the deck, players now need to Eliminate 6 enemy Command Cards in order to earn a Command Card Victory!
And now let's take a closer look at those T-Shirts...
So, £16,000 is the new goal... will you help us make this happen?!?!

Hello and thanks for having a look at Chroma Cubes, the color by number dice game!
 Chroma Cubes on Board Game Geek
Pictures included in the base game
ART PAD PACK
There is also an option to nab more artwork for Chroma Cubes in the Art Pad Pack. It will contain four pads of 10 double-sided sheets each with the following artwork:
Dice in the final version will be silkscreened.
The final dice will be silkscreened (colors printed on the flat die faces) instead of molded (colors applied into indentations on the die faces) due to the cost and complexity of creating molded dice with six different colors of ink on each die. (Check out your basic six-sided or polyhedral dice -- all the ink is one color.) 
Silkscreened dice still have good durability and let us bring you Chroma Cubes for the awesome price of just $25!
Pictures in the final version will use symbols to be colored in.
The symbols on the game sheets will match the symbols you roll on the dice to show you what you can color in on a turn. This will make the game language independent in addition to color-blind friendly. The symbols for each color are being finalized.
Want to give Chroma Cubes a try? Download the Print and Play here!
I liked it a LOT. It's a really fun game and well worth tracking down. - Eric Summerer
The game seemed like a nice casual affair until we saw that our dice started locking up [...] and then it got interesting! [...] I’m intrigued. - Matt Leacock (Pandemic, Roll Through The Ages, Forbidden Island)
Do you even get it? It's a game -- actually a clever, FUN game -- where you color pictures! It's like someone dared Charles to make a game with something that could never be used to make a game, and then he DID. I like it a lot. - Rich Sommer
Chroma Cubes’ color-by-number mechanic hides a game with depth and strategy. I went into the first game not expecting to have to think very much. But I was surprised. Planning and strategy abound here. It’s a really fun game on the light end of the strategy game spectrum with enough to satisfy the gamer in me. - Tom G - Go Forth And Game & The Geek Allstars
It brought me great joy to look around the table on game night to see all my 40-year-old friends coloring at the same time. You can’t buy moments like that. Oh, wait, yes you can. It’s called Chroma Cubes. - Scott, The Board Game Show
Chroma Cubes nails a perfect balance: It's extremely easy to learn, quick to play, offers all sorts of interesting decisions, and features a flexible game system that can be extended any number of ways. And how many games in your collection use crayons? - Gil Hova
The award for Most Innovative Game of TotalCon would go to Chroma Cubes. So simple, so different, and so jealous I didn't make this game. - Jason Tagmire
Chroma Cubes’ color-by-number mechanic hides a game with depth and strategy. I went into the first game not expecting to have to think very much. But I was surprised. Planning and strategy abound here. It’s a really fun game on the light end of the strategy game spectrum with enough to satisfy the gamer in me. - Tom Gurganus

In the Apocalypse Universe, heroes fight for the entertainment of the crowds. Single combat or Team vs Team. Choose your champions, choose their abilities and choose your destiny!
Overview
GALACTIC ARENA is a fast paced tactical battle BOARD GAME. Players choose a Hero or Heroes and take on the role of galactic gladiators. Your Heroes battle in the GALACTIC ARENA: an organized spectacle that is broadcast for the entertainment of the populace all over the galaxy.
Before the game starts, players secretly customize their Heroes. They choose special abilities and weapons from a large pool. They then enter the arena and duel each other in an exciting battle of wits and weapons. GALACTIC ARENA can be played 1vs1, 2vs2 or 3vs3. Only the best advance.
This game is the first in a series of interconnected board games set in the APOCALYPSE UNIVERSE. The Heroes in the GALACTIC ARENA are a part of a long story-line in a grand space opera with lots of drama, dangers and horrors. 
We have been developing the ideas behind the GALACTIC ARENA for the last 8 years and now we want to share them with you.  
So get ready for a competitive game like no other!
"It's a heck of a fun game and we had a blast playing it... I am always impressed when someone has made a game with all these variable powers and crazy critters and they are able to balance it. They have done that really, really well with this… This game is fantastic. It's a ton of fun!"- Undead Viking (UndeadVikingVideos)
  PLAY

             If you would like to try the game, a limited Print & Play version with 4 Heroes is available here:


 .
Dice help determine the results of a fight, a lucky turn could do 3 damage, or do none! Strategy also plays an important role. Simply attacking and defending leaves your results to chance.
PLAY

This game is part of the bigger Apocalypse Universe.
This is a quick game with lots of replay value.
The team behind the Galactic Arena are professionals.
The game is fun with lots of drama, excitement and conflict.
This is not about making money but making a game and the first step to bring the Apocalypse Universe to life.
